entries.title: Meta Plans to Begin Large-Scale Layoffs This Week
entries.description: The social-media giant’s planned cuts are expected to affect many thousands of its workforce, which exceeded 87,000 as of September.

entries.title: Startups Look to Scoop Up Laid-Off Tech Workers
entries.description: Flush with investor capital, technology startups plan to scoop up software developers, engineers and marketers flooding the labor market following job cuts at Twitter, Lyft and other large tech employers.

entries.title: Streaming Services Raise Prices Again. Here's How to Avoid Overpaying.
entries.description: Be on the lookout for increases from Apple, Disney, Netflix and plenty of others.

entries.title: As Growth Stalls, Amazon Sweetens the Deal
entries.description: Amazon has long had one of the most successful subscription programs but is seeking to offer more as competitors gain ground.

entries.title: Musk Defies Management Mantras With Rapid Overhaul at Twitter
entries.description: In his first week at Twitter, the billionaire fired top leaders, conducted sweeping layoffs and hinted that other changes could be on the way.
